intro: Anetanthus pusillus, commonly known as the dwarf anemone, is a small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its delicate, usually hairy leaves and showy, often pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are usually less than 2 centimeters in diameter, and it blooms in the spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
